title: Unicase: Anything New?
content:
Did a search here first (of course), but didn’t see any new unicase typefaces. However, I did find one via Google, called “Switch” from [www.typecuts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015195731/http:/www.typecuts.com/ "www.typecuts.com").

Anyone else out there in Typophileland found any new unicase typefaces lately?

Thanks,

Dylan

 [‹ Examples of Well-Designed Schedules](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015195731/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41601 "Go to previous forum topic") [Typophile's Favicon/Webicon ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015195731/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41570 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dylan

comments.content:
Seems that the wiki entry could use some more fleshing out. Perhaps a list of unicase fonts?

[http://typophile.com/node/39870](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015195731/http:/typophile.com/node/39870 "http://typophile.com/node/39870")?

Did some more hunting tonight...no luck. One of those days where I feel like I’m hunting for something that doesn’t exist. I might just go with “Switch” for now. It’s very close to what I’m looking for.

If anyone knows of new unicase typefaces that we’ve all missed, please post your links here!

Thanks,

D

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Build a man a fire, and he’ll be warm for a day.  
Set a man on fire, and he’ll be warm for the rest of his life.
